heaviest_rainfall.status: Record amounts of rain fell over 25.0 hours today with a total accumulation of 20.71mm.  It fell at 8.3 mm per hour at times and ranked 9th from our records.  On 09 November 2025, a record rainfall of 47.89mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  24.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 3 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.6.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 0 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (190°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 128.2 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 2.7°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 3.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (down 3.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 214 m), feels like temperature (down 2.6°C), outside temperature (down 2.0°C), and rainfall (down 4.0 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 77.6m lower than yesterday, 214.3m lower than the past week, 201.2m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 523m minimum and 933m maximum, with an average of 566.5m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 780.8m and 767.7m.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the air will feel dry and very little to no wind will be present. Light to moderate rain is forecast, fog or low cloud is expected, and it’s dark. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
